Exports.name: EXIT
Comments: Terminates the process normally, performing the regular cleanup for terminating programs.

Exports.name: __FGETC
Comments: Gets a character from the stream

Exports.name: AABBTV
Exports.Signature: int is=aabbtv(void *recptr, long abspos, int keynum);
Comments: 'Acquire' a Btrieve record from a file position

Exports.name: ABSBTV
Comments: Find current 'absolute' position

Exports.name: ACCBB
Comments: User Account Database BTRIEVE file pointer

Exports.name: ADDCRD
Comments: Utility for pasting credits to an account

Exports.name: ADDRES1
Comments: Mailing Address Line 1 of the MajorBBS System

Exports.name: ADDRES2
Comments: Mailing Address Line 2 of the MajorBBS System

Exports.name: ALCDUP
Comments: Allocate new space for a string

Exports.name: ALCMEM
Comments: Dynamically allocate some memory

Exports.name: ALCRSZ
Comments: Reallocate space to a different size

Exports.name: ALCZER
Comments: Allocate new memory and zero it out

Exports.name: ALLDGS
Comments: Determines if a string is all decimal (numeric) digits

Exports.name: ANSION
Comments: Enable/Disable ANSI graphics
1 == Process ANSI graphics sequences, 0 == Ignore

Exports.name: APPLYEM
Comments: Sets the CNF options in the specified file

Exports.name: ATOI
Comments: Converts a string to an integer

Exports.name: ATOL
Comments: Converts string to a long integer

Exports.name: AUXCRT
Comments: Gets Auxiliary CRT address

Exports.name: BAUDAT
Comments: Set color attribute based on baud

Exports.name: BBSTTL
Comments: Title of the MajorBBS System

Exports.name: BELPER
Comments: Beep the operator console

Exports.name: BGNCNC
Comments: Begins command concatenation

Exports.name: BOOTEM
Comments: Boot User-ID about to be killed

Exports.name: BYENOW
Exports.Signature: void byenow(int msgnum, TYPE p1, TYPE p2,...,pn);
Comments: Say good-bye to a user and disconnect (hang up)

Exports.name: CALCRC
Comments: Iteratively calcuate a 16-bit CRC

Exports.name: CATASTRO
Exports.Signature: catastro(char * ctlstg, TYPE pl, TYPE p2,...,pn)
Comments: Catastrophic Error, exit to DOS

Exports.name: CHANNEL
Comments: Array of chanel codes (as displayed)

Exports.name: CHGHOUR
Comments: Connect time charge per hour

Exports.name: CHGMIN
Comments: Minimum charge

Exports.name: CHIMOVE
Comments: Reentrant version of movemem()

Exports.name: CHROPT
Comments: Get a single character from an MCV file

Exports.name: CLREOL
Comments: Clear to end of line (in window)

Exports.name: CLRPRF
Comments: This function resets the 'prfptr' to point to the beginning of prfbuf and stores a \0 there.

Exports.name: CLSBTV
Comments: Closes a Btrieve file when finished

Exports.name: CLSMSG
Comments: Closes an MCV file

Exports.name: CNCALL
Comments: Expect a variable-length word sequance (consume all remaining input)

Exports.name: CNCCHR
Comments: Expect a character from the user (converted to upper case)
NULL if none

Exports.name: CNCHEX
Comments: Expect a hexadecimal number from the user
0 if none

Exports.name: CNCINT
Comments: Expect an integer from the user
0 if none

Exports.name: CNCLON
Comments: Expect a long integer from the user
0L if none

Exports.name: CNCNUM
Comments: Expect a decimal number with option '0' followed by decimal digits from the user
No conversion takes place -- returns the ASCII string

Exports.name: CNCSIG
Comments: Expect a forum name, with or without '/' prefix
Always returns name with the '/' prefix

Exports.name: CNCUID
Comments: Expect a User-ID or Forum name

Exports.name: CNCWRD
Comments: Expect a space-delimited word
Truncated if over 29 characters

Exports.name: CNCYESNO
Comments: Expect yes or no from the user
'Y' == yes, 'N' == no

Exports.name: COFDAT
Comments: Counts the number of days since 1/1/80
Input formatted as YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD

Exports.name: COMPANY
Comments: The Company name of the MajorBBS system

Exports.name: CONDEX
Comments: Conditional exit to parent menu for afte rhandling concatenated commands

Exports.name: CPUTYPE
Comments: Returns the CPU type as 88, 186, 286, 386 (486 returns 386)

Exports.name: CRTBTV
Exports.Signature: void crtbtv (char *filnam, void *databuf, int lendbuf, int keyno);

Exports.name: CURCURX
Comments: Gets the current cursor X coordinate

Exports.name: CURCURY
Comments: Gets the current cursor Y coordinate

Exports.name: CURSACT
Comments: Enable moving of blinking cursor
1 = move blinking cursor, 0 = still

Exports.name: CURUSR
Comments: Change to a different user number

Exports.name: DATAPH
Comments: The first phone line connected to the MajorBBS system

Exports.name: DATOFC
Comments: Compute DOS date
Return formatted as YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD

Exports.name: DAYTODAY
Comments: Returns the day of the week 0->6 Sunday->Saturday

Exports.name: DCDATE
Comments: Decode string date formatted 'MM/DD/YY' to int format YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD

Exports.name: DCLVDA
Comments: Declare size of the Volatile Data Area (Maximum size the modeule will require)

Exports.name: DEDCRD
Comments: Deduct credits from current user's account
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: DELBTV
Comments: Delete current Btrieve record

Exports.name: DEPAD
Comments: Removes trailing blank spaces from string

Exports.name: DFSTHN
Comments: Default Status Handler for status conditions this module is not specifically expecting

Exports.name: DINSBTV
Comments: (more tolerant) Insert a new Btrieve record

Exports.name: DSAIRP
Comments: Disable Interrupts

Exports.name: DUPDBTV
Comments: (more tolerant) update current record
1 == updated, 0 == duplicate collision

Exports.name: ECHON
Comments: Turns echo on for this channel

Exports.name: ECHONU
Comments: Turns on echo utility for the specified user

Exports.name: ENAIRP
Comments: Enable Interrupts

Exports.name: ENDCNC
Comments: Checks if the user has completed their command (started by bgncnc())
1 == done, 2 == there's more

Exports.name: ERRCOD
Comments: MS-DOS exit code (for batch files)

Exports.name: EURMSK
Comments: 0x7F if U.S.A. only, 0xFF if European

Exports.name: FCLOSE
Comments: Closes the file associated with the stream and disassociates it.

Exports.name: _FGETC
Comments: Returns the character currently pointed by the internal file position indicator of the specified stream

Exports.name: FGETS
Exports.Signature: char* fgets(char* str, int num, FILE* stream );
Comments: Reads characters from stream as a C string into str until (num-1) characters have been read or either a newline or the end-of-file is reached

Exports.name: FINDTVAR
Comments: Find text variable & return number

Exports.name: F_OPEN
Comments: Opens a file for reading, but differs from C++ standard fopen() by taking 2nd parameter
2nd Parameter determines how the file will be used

Exports.name: F_PRINTF
Exports.Signature: int fprintf ( FILE * stream, const char * format, ... );
Comments: Writes the C string pointed by format to the stream.

Exports.name: F_PUTC
Comments: Write the input character to the specified stream

Exports.name: F_PUTCHAR
Comments: Writes a character to the standard output (stdout).

Exports.name: F_READ
Exports.Signature: size_t fread(void* ptr, size_t size, size_t count, FILE* stream );
Comments: Reads an array of count elements, each one with a size of size bytes, from the stream and stores them in the block of memory specified by ptr.

Exports.name: FSDANS
Comments: Install answer string & compute ansoff,anslen fields (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDAPR
Comments: Prepare answers (call after fsdroom()) (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDBD1
Comments: 1st step to building an answer string (Full Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDBDF
Comments: Build answer string from field # from recent session (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDBDN
Comments: Next step to building an answer string (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDBKG
Comments: Display background for Full-Screen entry mode (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDDAN
Comments: Delete answer just found by fsdxan() from its answer string (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDDSP
Comments: Display screen & filled-in fields (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDEGO
Exports.Signature: void fsdego(int (*fldvfy)(int fldno, char *answer), void (*whndun)(int save));
Comments: Begin Full-Screen Data Entry session (call after fsdroom(), fsdapr())

Exports.name: FSDEMG
Comments: Error message for fsdppc(), fsdprc(), etc. (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDENT
Comments: Begin Full-Screen Data Entry session (ANSI-only)

Exports.name: FSDFXT
Comments: Store answer for field into buffer (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDINC
Comments: Handle incoming character (ANSI-only) (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDINI
Comments: Power-up init for Full Scren Data Entry software

Exports.name: FSDLIN
Comments: Begin data entry for non-ANSI (ASCII-only) users (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDMAN
Comments: Stuff more answers into current session (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDNAN
Comments: Get a field's answer (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDNFY
Comments: Notify system to call fsdprc() when it can (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDOBA
Comments: Number of output buffer bytes available

Exports.name: FSDORD
Comments: Returns ordinal value of multiple-choice answer, per field spec (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDOUC
Comments: Display a Character (Full-Screen Data Entry

Exports.name: FSDOUS
Comments: Display String (Full-Screen Data Entry)

Exports.name: FSDROOM
Exports.Signature: int fsdroom(int tmpmsg, char *fldspc, int amode);
Comments: Returns number of bytes session will need, or -1=error in data

Exports.name: FSEEK
Exports.Signature: int fseek ( FILE * stream, long int offset, int origin );
Comments: Sets the position indicator associated with the stream to a new position.

Exports.name: FTELL
Comments: Gets the current position in the stream

Exports.name: FWRITE
Exports.Signature: size_t fwrite ( const void * ptr, size_t size, size_t count, FILE * stream );
Comments: Writes an array of count elements, each one with a size of size bytes, from the block of memory pointed by ptr to the current position in the stream.

Exports.name: GABBTV
Comments: Get a Btrieve record by 'absolute' position

Exports.name: GEN_HASKEY
Exports.Signature: int ok=gen_haskey(char *lock, int unum, struct user *uptr);
Comments: Does this user have the key to this lock?

Exports.name: GENRDN
Comments: Generates a random number between min and max

Exports.name: GETASC
Comments: Read value of CNF option (text blocks with ASCII compatible line terminators)

Exports.name: GETBTV
Exports.Signature: void getbtv(char *recptr, char *key, int keynum, int getopt);
Comments: Get a Btrieve record (bomb if not there)

Exports.name: GETDTD
Comments: Returns a file date and time
handle from a fopen()'d file

Exports.name: GETENV
Comments: Retrieves a C-string containing the value of the environment variable whose name is specified in the argument

Exports.name: GETMSG
Comments: Read value of CNF option

Exports.name: GETTND
Comments: Returns a file's date and time (GMT)

Exports.name: GLOBALCMD
Comments: Defines a global command handler routine

Exports.name: GMDNAM
Comments: Get's a module's name from the specified .MDF file

Exports.name: GOPAGE
Comments: Jump to a specific page (or file)

Exports.name: HASKEY
Comments: Does the user have the specified key

Exports.name: HASMKEY
Comments: Returns if the user has the key specified in an offline Security and Accounting option
1 == yes, 0 == no

Exports.name: HDLUID
Comments: Handle the entering of a User-Id

Exports.name: HEXOPT
Exports.Signature: unsigned hval=hexopt(int msgnum, unsigned floor, unsigned ceil);
Comments: Get hex option from an MCV file

Exports.name: INIMSG
Comments: Initializes the message buffer

Exports.name: INJACR
Comments: Injects a <CR> into the current channel

Exports.name: INJOTH
Comments: Inject a message to another user (implicit inputs othusn, prfbuf).
1 = User got it, 0 = User was busy

Exports.name: INPLEN
Comments: Total length us the user input in bytes

Exports.name: INPUT
Comments: User Input lines

Exports.name: INSBTV
Comments: Insert new fixed-length Btrieve record

Exports.name: INSTAT
Comments: Determines if a user is using a specific module

Exports.name: INVBTV
Comments: Insert variable length Btrieve record

Exports.name: ISSELC
Comments: Checks if the input is a valid menu-select character
1 == yes, 0 == no

Exports.name: ISTXVC
Comments: Checks if the input is a valid text-variable character
1 == yes, 0 == no

Exports.name: ISUIDC
Comments: Checks if the input is a valid user-id character
1 == yes, 0 == no

Exports.name: ITOA
Exports.Signature: char *  itoa ( int value, char * str, int base );
Comments: Converts an integer value to a null-terminated string using the specified base and stores the result in the array given by str

Exports.name: KILIPG
Comments: Kill-system command in progress

Exports.name: L2AS
Comments: Converts a long to an ASCII string

Exports.name: LASTWD
Comments: Get the last word of a string

Exports.name: LDEDCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=ldedcrd(struct useracc *uptr, long amount, int real, int asmuch);
Comments: Deduct credits from an 'active' user account structure residing in memory
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: LIVEPH
Comments: The first phone lie reserved for live users

Exports.name: LLNBTV
Comments: Find the record length of the most recently read record

Exports.name: LNGOPT
Comments: Gets a large numeric option from the MCV File

Exports.name: LOCATE
Comments: Move cursor to specified X,Y

Exports.name: LONSTF
Comments: Supplemental log-on 'stuff'

Exports.name: MAKHDL
Comments: 'Make Handle' for use with Btrieve

Exports.name: MARGC
Comments: Number of words in the user input line
Value initalized by parsin()

Exports.name: MARGN
Comments: An Array of pointers to the ENDS of the words in the user's input line
Value initalized by parsin()

Exports.name: MARGV
Comments: An array of pointers to the words in user's input line
Value initalized by parsin()

Exports.name: MDFGETS
Comments: Read a line of text from a file

Exports.name: MEMCMP
Exports.Signature: int memcmp ( const void * ptr1, const void * ptr2, size_t num );
Comments: Compares the first num bytes of the block of memory pointed by ptr1 to the first num bytes pointed by ptr2, returning zero if they all match or a value different from zero representing which is greater if they do not.

Exports.name: MEMCPY
Exports.Signature: void* memcpy (void* destination, const void* source,size_t num );
Comments: Copies the values of num bytes from the location pointed to by source directly to the memory block pointed to by destination.

Exports.name: MEMSET
Exports.Signature: void memset(void *ptr, int value, size_t num);
Comments: Sets the first num bytes of the block of memory with the specified value

Exports.name: MJRMB
Comments: Executive named-message file block prt

Exports.name: MMUCRR
Comments: Main menu credit consumption rate per minute

Exports.name: MNUOFF
Comments: Returns the pointer of the User's menu info

Exports.name: MODULE
Comments: Module Interface Block that contains method references for system events (logoff supplemental, login supplemental, etc.)

Exports.name: MORCNC
Comments: Checks to see if there's any more command to parse
NULL if none

Exports.name: MOVMEM
Comments: Move a block of memory
Translates in .H file to either memmove(d,s,n) or memcpy(d,s,n) depending on MS version

Exports.name: MSGSCAN
Comments: Read a CNF option from a .MSG file

Exports.name: NCDATE
Comments: Encode date into 'MM/DD/YY' format

Exports.name: NCEDAT
Comments: Converts date from int format YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD to 'DD-MMM-YY'

Exports.name: NCTIME
Comments: Encode the time into 'HH:MM:SS'
Input is int returned from time()

Exports.name: NDEDCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=ndedcrd(char *userid, long amount, int real, int asmuch);
Comments: Deduct credits from an offline account

Exports.name: NMODS
Comments: Number of modules currently online

Exports.name: NOW
Comments: Returns the time of day it is bitwise HHHHHMMMMMMSSSSS coding
HHHHH * 2048 representing 0 through 23
MMMMMM * 32 representing 0 through 59
SSSSS representing the even numbers 0 though 58
Use nctime() to parse

Exports.name: NTERMS
Comments: Total number of channels defined

Exports.name: NUMOPT
Comments: Retrieves a numeric option from MCV file

Exports.name: NXTCMD
Comments: The global variable 'nxtcmd' in CNCUTL.C keeps track of what has already been interpreted from the user's command - it points to the rest of the command.

Exports.name: OBTBTV
Exports.Signature: int obtbtv(char *recptr, char* key, int keynum, int obtopt);
Comments: Acquire a record (if you can) from Btrieve

Exports.name: ODD
Comments: Compute odd parity of the input

Exports.name: ODEDCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=odedcrd(int unum, long amount, int real, int asmuch);
Comments: Deduct credits from an online account

Exports.name: ONBBS
Comments: Is a userid ANYWHERE on the BBS? (even logging in)
0 == use INVISB flag in decision
1 == ignore INVISB flag

Exports.name: ONSYS
Comments: Determines if a user is online
1 == user is online & logged in

Exports.name: ONSYSN
Comments: Checks uid to see if they're on the system

Exports.name: OPNBTV
Comments: Opens a Btrieve file for I/O

Exports.name: OPNMSG
Comments: Opens the specified CNF file (.MCV in runtime form)
Prior PUSH contains file name reference

Exports.name: OTHUAP
Comments: Pointer to structure for that user in the 'usracc' structure (set by onsys() or instat())

Exports.name: OTHUSN
Comments: User Number of the other user (set by onsys() or instat())

Exports.name: OTHUSP
Comments: Pointer to structure for that user in the user[] array (set by onsys() or instat())

Exports.name: OTSTCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=otstcrd(int unum, long amount, int real);
Comments: Test if the user has enough credits
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: OUTBSZ
Comments: Output buffer size per channel

Exports.name: OUTPRF
Comments: Send prfbuf to a channel & clear

Exports.name: PARSIN
Comments: Parses the input line (null terminating each word)

Exports.name: PFNLVL
Comments: 'Profanity Level' of the Input (from configuration)

Exports.name: PRF
Comments: Like printf(), except the converted text goes into a buffer

Exports.name: PRFBUF
Comments: Output buffer of prd() and prdmsg()

Exports.name: PRFMSG
Comments: Like prf(), but the control string comes from an .MCV file
Preceding PUSH holds the Message # from the .MCV file

Exports.name: PRFPTR
Comments: Pointer to the current position in prfbuf

Exports.name: QNPBTV
Comments: Query Next/Previous Btrieve utility

Exports.name: QRYBTV
Exports.Signature: int is=qrybtv(char *key, int keynum, int qryopt);
Comments: Query whether a record exists
1 == exists, 0 == doesn't exist

Exports.name: RAND
Comments: Returns a pseudo-random integral number in the range between 0 and RAND_MAX.

Exports.name: RAWMSG
Comments: Read value of CNF option

Exports.name: RDEDCRD
Comments: Deduct real credits from online acct
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: REGISTER_MODULE
Comments: Registers the Module with the MajorBBS system

ReturnValues.Name: statecode
ReturnValues.Comment: Value of usrptr->state whenever user will in 'in' this module

Exports.name: REGISTER_TEXTVAR
Comments: Registers a Text Variable for use

Exports.name: RENAME
Comments: Changes the name of the file or directory specified by oldname to newname

Exports.name: REPMEM
Comments: Replicate a pattern in memory

Exports.name: RMVWHT
Comments: Remove all whitespace characters

Exports.name: RSMODE
Comments: Reset-mode code for channels

Exports.name: RSMODES
Comments: Reset-mode array by channel number

Exports.name: RSTBTV
Comments: Restores the last Btrieve data block for use

Exports.name: RSTCHN
Comments: Completely reset a modem channel

Exports.name: RSTMBK
Comments: Restore previous MCV file block ptr from before last setmbk() call

Exports.name: RSTRIN
Comments: Restore parsed input line (under effects of parsin()

Exports.name: RSTRXF
Comments: Restores screen-length to usracc setting

Exports.name: RTIHDLR
Comments: Register a real-time routine which requires it be executed more than once per second
Executes at 18hz

Exports.name: RTKICK
Comments: 'Kick Off' routine after time delay

Exports.name: RTSTCRD
Comments: Test if the user has enough real credits
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: SAMEAS
Comments: Case-ignoring string match
Returns 1 if match, 0 otherwise

Exports.name: SAMEIN
Comments: Searches the string for any accurance of the substring
Returns 1 if it finds any

Exports.name: SAMETO
Comments: Case-ignoring substring match

Exports.name: SETBTV
Comments: Used to set the Btrieve file for all subsequent database functions

Exports.name: SETCRIT
Comments: Sets the DOS critical error handler to a routine that pops up a window

Exports.name: SETDTD
Exports.Signature: int ok=setdtd(char *fname, int time, int date);
Comments: Sets the date and time on a file

Exports.name: SETMBK
Comments: Sets the 'current' MCV file block pointer

Exports.name: SETMEM
Exports.Signature: void setmem(char *destination, unsigned nbytes, char value);
Comments: Set a block of memory to a value

Exports.name: SETTND
Comments: Sets the date and time for a file

Exports.name: SHOCHL
Comments: Show legend for channel with any attribute

Exports.name: SHOCST
Comments: Displays a message in the Audit Trail
(summary max length = 32, detail max length = 64)

Exports.name: SKPWHT
Comments: Skip past whitespace, returns pointer to the first NULL or non-whitespace character in the string

Exports.name: SKPWRD
Comments: Skip past non-white spaces, returns first NULL or whitespace character in the string

Exports.name: SND2CH
Comments: Sends text to the specified channel

Exports.name: SORTSTGS
Comments: Sorts a bunch of strings by re-arranging an array of pointers

Exports.name: SPR
Comments: sprintf-like string formatter utility
Main differentiator is that spr() supports long integer and floating point conversions

Exports.name: SPRINTF
Comments: sprintf() function in C++ to handle string formatting

Exports.name: SRAND
Comments: The pseudo-random number generator is initialized using the argument passed as seed.

Exports.name: SSCANF
Comments: Reads data from s and stores them accounting to parameter format into the locations given by the additional arguments

Exports.name: STANSI
Comments: Set ANSI handling to useracc setting

Exports.name: STATUS
Comments: Raw status from btusts, where appropriate

Exports.name: STGOPT
Comments: Gets a string from an MCV file

Exports.name: STPBTV
Comments: 'Step' based Btrieve operation

Exports.name: STRCAT
Comments: Concatenates two strings

Exports.name: STRCHR
Exports.Signature: char * strchr ( const char * str, int character );
Comments: Returns a pointer to the first occuence of character in the C string str

Exports.name: STRCMP
Exports.Signature: int strcmp ( const char * str1, const char * str2 );
Comments: Compares the C string str1 to the C string str2

Exports.name: STRCPY
Exports.Signature: char* strcpy(char* destination, const char* source );
Comments: Copies the C string pointed by source into the array pointed by destination, including the terminating null character

Exports.name: STRICMP
Comments: Compares strings without case sensitivity
0 == same

Exports.name: STRLEN
Comments: Returns the length of the C string str.

Exports.name: STRLWR
Comments: Converts all uppercase letters in the string to lowercase

Exports.name: STRNCAT
Comments: Appends the first num characters of source to destination, plus a terminating null-character.

Exports.name: STRNCPY
Comments: Copioes characters from a string

Exports.name: STRSTR
Comments: Returns a pointer to the first occurence of str2 in str1, or a null pointer if str2 is not part of str1

Exports.name: STRTOK
Comments: Splits the specified string into tokens based on the delimiters

Exports.name: STRUPR
Comments: Converts all lowercase letters in 'string' to uppercase

Exports.name: STZCPY
Comments: Copies a string with a limit

Exports.name: SV
Comments: System-Variable Btrieve Record Layout Struct (1 of 3)

Exports.name: SV2
Comments: System-Variable Btrieve Record Layout Struct (2 of 3)

Exports.name: TIME
Comments: Get the current calendar time as a value of type time_t.

Exports.name: TODAY
Comments: Find out today's date coded as YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD
(YYYYYYY-1980) * 512 representing 1980 through 2170
(MMMM*32) representing 1 through 12
DDDDD representing 1 through 31

Exports.name: TOKOPT
Comments: Checks a type E CNF option for one of several possible values
0 == not found, >= 1 == token number that was found

Exports.name: TOLOWER
Comments: Converts a uppercase letter to lowercase

Exports.name: TOUPPER
Comments: Converts a lowercase letter to uppercase

Exports.name: TSTCRD
Comments: Test if the user has enough credits
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: UIDXRF
Comments: User-id cross reference structure

Exports.name: UINSYS
Comments: Determine if a user is online
1 == online anywhere in the system

Exports.name: UISUSN
Comments: Global Variable set when uinsys() returns 1

Exports.name: UNGETC
Comments: Ungets character from stream and decreases the internal file position by 1

Exports.name: UNPAD
Comments: Remove trailing blanks from input string

Exports.name: UPDBTV
Comments: Update the Btrieve current record

Exports.name: UPVBTV
Comments: Update variable length Btrieve record

Exports.name: USAPTR
Comments: Points to that channel's 'usracc' struct

Exports.name: USER
Comments: Contains information about the current user account (class, state, baud, etc.)

Exports.name: USRIDX
Comments: Find 'usernum' given visible channel number

Exports.name: USRNUM
Comments: Property with the User Number (Channel) of the user currently being serviced

Exports.name: USRPTR
Comments: Points to that channels 'user' struct

Exports.name: VDAOFF
Comments: Compute volatile data pointer for another user

Exports.name: VDAPTR
Comments: Points to the Volatile Data Area
This is memory allocated for a channel and is used by the routines of a module

Exports.name: VDASIZ
Comments: Maximum size requirement of volatile data

Exports.name: VDATMP
Comments: Points to the ad-hoc Volatile Data Area

Exports.name: VSPRINTF
Exports.Signature: int vsprintf(char *s, const char *format, va_list arg);
Comments: Writes formatted data from variable argument list to string

Exports.name: XLTCTLS
Comments: Translate ASCII control characters

Exports.name: XLTTXV
Comments: Translate buffer (possible tvars)

Exports.name: YNOPT
Comments: Retrieves a yes/no option from an MCV file, flag == 1 if value started with 'Y'

Exports.name: F_LDIV
Comments: Long Division (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Input: Two long values on stack
Output: DX:AX = arg1 / arg2

Exports.name: F_LMOD
Comments: Modulo (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Input: Two long values on stack
Output: DX:AX = arg1 % arg2

Exports.name: F_LUDIV
Comments: Long Division, non-significant (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Input: Two long values on stack
Output: DX:AX = arg1 / arg2

Exports.name: F_LUMOD
Comments: Modulo, non-significant (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Input: Two long values on stack
Output: DX:AX = arg1 % arg2

Exports.name: F_LXLSH
Comments: Long Shift Left (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
DX:AX == Long Value
CL == How many to move

Exports.name: F_LXMUL
Comments: Long Multiplication (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Output: DX:AX = DX:AX * CX:BX

Exports.name: F_LXRSH
Comments: Long Shift Right (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
DX:AX == Long Value
CL == How many to move

Exports.name: F_LXURSH
Comments: Long Shift Right, non-significant (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
DX:AX == Long Value
CL == How many to move

Exports.name: F_SCOPY
Comments: Copies Struct into another Struct (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Aguments: Two Far Pointers, 1st == Source, 2nd == Destination

Aguments: Two Far Pointers, 1st == Source, 2nd == Destination

Exports.name: FND1ST
Exports.Signature: int yes=fndlst(struct fndblk &fb, filespec, char attr);
Comments: Any files in this filespec?
1 == 1 or more, 0 = none

Exports.name: FNDNXT
Comments: Any more files in this filespec?
1 == yes, 0 == no more

Exports.name: GRPNUM
Comments: Array of group numbers, by channel number

Exports.name: UACOFF
Comments: Gets the online user account info

Exports.name: HICHP1
Comments: Highest Channel numberin use, plus 1

Exports.name: NUMCAT
Comments: Number of cancat'd commands so far

Exports.name: CHGTIME
Comments: Minimum connect time to be charged

Exports.name: MMUATR
Comments: Default attribute for main menu selections

Exports.name: ANSDIM
Comments: Dimmed attribute for main menu selections

Exports.name: VISPSW
Comments: Make passwords visible in detail displays?

Exports.name: MAXCAT
Comments: Maximum number of concat'd commands

Exports.name: SVRATE
Comments: How many seconds between saving sysvbls?

Exports.name: GDEDCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=gdedcrd(char *userid, long amount, int real, int asmuch);
Comments: Deduct credits from any user's account
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: NTSTCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=ntstcrd(char *userid, long amount, int real);
Comments: Test if the offline user has enough credits
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: LTSTCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=ltstcrd(struct usracc *uptr, long amount, int real);
Comments: Tests if the user account structure has enough credits
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: GTSTCRD
Exports.Signature: int enuf=gtstcrd(char *userid, long amount, int real);
Comments: Tests if any user has enough credits
1 == enough, 0 == not enough

Exports.name: UHSKEY
Comments: Does the user have this key?
1 == yes, 0 == no

Exports.name: HDLC25
Comments: Handle incoming X.25 call string (margv)

Exports.name: HDLNRG
Comments: Handle non-RING strings during AWAITC

Exports.name: TXTVARS
Comments: Text Variable Structure

Exports.name: REGISTER_PSEUDOK
Exports.Signature: void register_pseudok(char *prefix, int (*rouptr)(int unum, char* lock));
Comments: Registers a pseudo-key routine

Exports.name: NLINGO
Comments: Number of languages defined, always at least 1

Exports.name: CLINGO
Comments: Language index for the current user

Exports.name: LANGUAGES
Comments: Dynamic array of pointers to lingo structures

Exports.name: TFSTATE
Comments: tfsrdl() state code and return value
0 == tfsrdl() done scanning file(s)
1 == tfsopn() has been called, tfsrdl() calls will begin
3 == tfsrdl() has a line for you
4 == tfsrdl() is done with a file

Exports.name: TFSBUF
Comments: After tfsrdl() returns TFSLIN, the line goes here

Exports.name: TFSPST
Comments: When tfspfx() returns 1, this is spkwht(what follows it)

Exports.name: TFSFB
Comments: fndblk structure from current file

Exports.name: TFSFP
Comments: File pointer while tfsrdl() returns TFSLIN

Exports.name: TFSOPN
Comments: Prepare to scan 1 or more text files
TFS prefix == 'Text File Scanner'

Exports.name: TFSRDL
Comments: Read the next line from the file(s) opened with tfsopn()

Exports.name: TFSPFX
Comments: Is the current line of a file opened with tfsopn prefixed with the specified string
1 == yes, 2 == no

Exports.name: TFSDPR
Comments: Strip the previx off tfsbuf and prepare for sub-prefixes (dpr stands for 'deeper')

Exports.name: HDLRNG
Comments: Handle RING (non X-25) during AWAITC, HARING

Exports.name: HDLCNC
Comments: Hand non-RING whatever during HARING

Exports.name: CLRMLT
Comments: Clear the prf buffer indep of outprf
Multilingual version of clrprf()

Exports.name: OUTMLT
Comments: Send prfbuf to a channel & clear
Multilingual version of outprf()

Exports.name: PRFMLT
Comments: Like pmlt(), but the control string comes from an .MCV file
Preceding PUSH holds the Message # from the .MCV file
Multilingual version of prfmsg()

Exports.name: PMLT
Comments: Like printf(), except the converted text goes into a buffer
Multilingual version of prf()

Exports.name: CNCLNG
Comments: Expect a language name of language pick from a numbered list
-1 == invalid name

Exports.name: AUSWAIT
Comments: Master timeout, 1/16 of second units

Exports.name: ECHSEC
Comments: Echo secretly (password masking)

Exports.name: SAMEND
Comments: Compares ending of strings, checking if the first string ends with the second string (ignoring case)

Exports.name: FGETSTG
Comments: Read a NULL-terminated string from a file

Exports.name: LINGYN
Comments: Translates a user's yes/no in 'Y'/'N'

Exports.name: OTHEXP
Comments: Global Pointer to extendable in-memory structure for that user (set by onsys() or instat())

Exports.name: EXTOFF
Comments: Gets the extended User Account Information

Exports.name: ECHTYP
Comments: Array of Echo Options:
0 == No Echo at all of user keystrokes
1 == echo comes from users's PAD
2 == Echo comes from the BBS thru X.25 net

Exports.name: ALCTILE
Comments: Allocate a very large memory region

Exports.name: PTRTILE
Comments: Dereference an alctile() region

Exports.name: NTVARS
Comments: Number of text variables in memory

Exports.name: HRTVAL
Comments: Read the free-running 65khz timer (not a typo)

Exports.name: WRITE
Exports.Signature: ostream& write (const char* s, streamsize n);
Comments: Inserts the first n characters of the array pointed by s into the stream.

Exports.name: ALCBLOK
Comments: Allocate a very large memory region, qty by sizblock bytes

Exports.name: PTRBLOK
Comments: Dereference an alcblok()'d region

Exports.name: F_SPUSH
Comments: Store Struct on storage (Borland C++ Implicit Function)
Arguments: DX:AX - Far Pointers to the struct, CX - size in bytes

Exports.name: TFSABT
Comments: Aborts text file scanning

Exports.name: FNROOT
Comments: Returns the 1-8 character file name from the specified file

Exports.name: FNWEXT
Comments: Returns the file name with extension

Exports.name: RSVNAM
Comments: Checks if a file name is reserved
1 == Reserved, 0 == OK

Exports.name: CLSIZE
Comments: Returns the size of the clusters on the disk

Exports.name: DRVNUM
Comments: Determine drive number from the path

Exports.name: CLFIT
Comments: Total space used by a file based on cluster size

Exports.name: VERSION
Comments: Main version code of The MajorBBS, in form X.YY

Exports.name: SV3
Comments: System-Variable Btrieve Record Layout Struct (3 of 3)

Exports.name: SAMPLN
Comments: Number of 'free sample' channels

Exports.name: GABBTVL
Exports.Signature: void gabbtv (void *recptr, long abspos, int keynum);
Comments: Gets a Btrieve record from a file position

Exports.name: HDLRST
Comments: Handle Channel Reset

Exports.name: BBSFVC
Comments: Find a vacant GCDI channel
-1 == none available

Exports.name: BBSDSC
Comments: Disconnect an interactive user

Exports.name: CHKUID
Comments: Vector for approving User-ID
0 == User OK
1 == User logged on already
2 == Doesn't have SAMPKY key
3 == User suspended
4 == User-ID not on file
5 == app-specific rejection

Exports.name: LONAUD
Comments: Make an audit trail entry for each logon?

Exports.name: LONCDI
Comments: Handle login audit trail msg on GCDI channel

Exports.name: SYSCYC
Comments: System-cycle vector (tail is prctask())

Exports.name: CHNCYC
Comments: Channel-cycle vector (tail is dwopr())

Exports.name: LSTUNM
Comments: Last user-number returned by btuscn()

Exports.name: NEWUNM
Comments: New user-number just returned by btuscn()

Exports.name: RCDBAUD
Comments: Record the channel baud rate

Exports.name: GRTSUB
Comments: Array of GCDI channel type names

Exports.name: NUMCDI
Comments: Counts the hnumber of GCDI channels
*chtype corresponding to MDF 'Channel Type', null == all GCDI types

Exports.name: HDLRLG
Comments: Handle relogging on a new user

Exports.name: HDLZAP
Comments: Handle zapping an idle channel

Exports.name: ACTDET
Comments: Activity detected in this channel cycle

Exports.name: OUTATA
Comments: Output ATA to modems when Answering?

Exports.name: HDLSMP
Comments: Handle sample vs. paying channel determin

Exports.name: CHKACC
Comments: Handle final accounting of logon

Exports.name: CHKPSW
Comments: Vector for approving password

Exports.name: SFTRAK
Comments: Source file tracking

Exports.name: SLTRAK
Comments: Source line tracking

Exports.name: MXBAUDL
Comments: Array of maximum baud rates, by chan group

Exports.name: CSVCRR
Comments: C/S credit consumption rate per minute

Exports.name: BBSCON
Comments: Somebody wants to connect to the BBS
0 == channel busy/inappropriate
1 == ok

Exports.name: VALLON
Comments: Vector for final logon validation

Exports.name: ISERRF
Comments: Determines if the channel is 'error free'
